docs.text:
GraderQueue / GraderServer


The grader queue is a queue to relay tasks to be evaluated by grader servers. It receives tasks from platforms such as 
TaskPlatform
, send them to grader servers according to their priority and tags, and then once evaluated, sends back the results to the platform.




Troubleshooting
docs.title: Home

docs.text: The grader queue is a queue to relay tasks to be evaluated by grader servers. It receives tasks from platforms such as  TaskPlatform , send them to grader servers according to their priority and tags, and then once evaluated, sends back the results to the platform.   Troubleshooting
docs.title: GraderQueue / GraderServer

docs.text:
Troubleshooting


If the grader queue stops working, here are a few steps to try and find the issue.


Tasks accumulating in queue


If no tasks are getting evaluated, here are a few things to check :




Which state are the servers in? Check the section below for more information.


Check the log, a task could be causing issues; the log will contain the ID of the task and the server causing issues


Remove the first tasks in the table 
queue
 and see if it unblocks the queue




Servers


The servers can be in multiple statuses :




busy
 : the server is currently evaluating one or more tasks. If the server doesn't return results after the timeout (default is 5 minutes), the graderqueue will send the task to another server


polling
 : the server just connected to the graderqueue, and is waiting for a task but didn't get one yet


sleeping
 : the server is waiting for the graderqueue to wake it up; it is currently idle. Note that if a server is 
sleeping
 while there are tasks for it, for less than 10 minutes, it may mean the server is waiting for its health to regenerate (for instance, when an EC2 server is out of credits).




Some commands to help :




systemctl status graderserver
 will show the last log lines of the graderserver; it will typically show what the server is doing


systemctl restart graderserver
 will restart the graderserver; it may take a few seconds if the graderserver is currently evaluating a task, but a timeout will kill it to restart it if it takes too long




Some logs to look at (on France-ioi's installation) :




/var/log/graderserver.log
 : graderserver log


/home/grader/taskgrader/taskgrader.log
 : taskgrader log




These logs will generally contain some more information about :




whether the server is receiving tasks to evaluate (and their ID)


whether it manages to fetch the task data from the repository


whether it manages to execute the taskgrader for evaluating the task


whether the taskgrader evaluated successfully


some basic results about the task
